Reviews.Title: “Home from home”
Reviews.Author: Sazza23
Reviews.Content: This my third stay at the Marmara Manhattan (March 2012), and it wont be my last ! Elif was very helpful with my booking and our 1 bed apartment was fab - we had wonderful views of 2nd Avenue and a view of the RFK Bridge (aka Triboro Bridge) and the East River. The facilities include a fully equipped kitchen with a dishwasher. The Reception staff are all very helpful, it is worth noting that Housekeeping work until 5pm(?) at the Marmara, so if you're an 'early bird' you can ask that your apt be serviced by a specified time. There is plenty of closet space but as normal in most hotels, not enough hangars for us (8 I think). 2 flat screen TV's (bed and living room). The bed was really comfortable. All the furnishing is modern and light, a refreshing change to the normal 'chintzy', patterned style that is common in a lot of hotels. The 2nd Ave construction work has been ongoing for all our visits but that has not bothered us. There are plenty of great places to eat, the area is very good and the subway is not that far away. All in all I would say this is our favourite place to stay in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Ketiljt
Reviews.Content: We had a one bedroom suite, spacious and modern. Nice view, nice interior and nice staff. Location ok, several restaurants and diners nearby, short distance to bus and subway.

Reviews.Title: “A very good experience!! Close to Museum Mile”
Reviews.Author: Ingrid A
Reviews.Content: At first we were very concerned when we arrived to 2nd Avenue and we saw the subway construction that was there. But we were pleasantly surprised when we were shown our 1 bedroom suite on the 22nd floor. It had a great view, nice light wooden furniture and the bed was very good. However, the sofa bed was not as good as the rest of the furniture and it was a little difficult to handle. The kitchen was nice and very well equipped. The apartment was very clean and the towels were of very good quality. It was also difficult to adjust the heater to the desired temperature. The noise of the construction was not really a problem since we were on the 22nd floor, but some dust clouds at the entrance of the Hotel bothered us when we were going out or coming back. The location was very good, close to the Museum Mile, and despite the construction we really enjoyed our stay there and would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: FrannyK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marmara Feb 10 for the weekend. Our daughter moved to Manhattan in September and this was our first weekend visit. We chose the Marmara because it is directly across the street from her apartment and because of the glowing reviews on TA. We paid for a studio ($169) but were thrilled to be upgraded to a one-bedroom on the 8th floor upon arrival. The apartment was lovely, clean and super spacious, especially for NYC. The view was amazing. Yes, there is major construction going on out front but it was no problem getting around and the noise was minimal. The apartment had every amenity you could ask for. The doorman was so helpful and all the staff we came across were warm, friendly and eager to please. We really felt we hit the jackpot with this place and it will be our "go to" place when visiting NYC. The Upper East Side was such a nice change from downtown! Nicks Restaurant across the street from Marmara had fantastic food, best veal I've EVER had and their pizza is amazing too. The Barking Dog for breakfast was amazing with the most unusual omlettes. We walked to Central Park and Museum Mile which were lovely. Can't wait for our next stay and exploring more of the Upper East Side!

Reviews.Title: “congratulations”
Reviews.Author: philippe m
Reviews.Content: I've booked for my daughter 'Christmas a 5 days 3 nights in the Marmara Hotel. One week just before flying (from 03/3 to 03/7/12) I add two person in my one bedroom suite standard (my son and his girl friend) and all the employees were able to find a great solution. The "flat" is functional with a complete kitchen and a great view from the balcony. I would like to say thanks to Maureen and Ashley for their great help and welcome. I would book this hotel again. A special thanks to the taxi driver (EDDY 9179302046) to bring us quickly from newark to the hotel (plus he spoke French)

Reviews.Title: “Superb apartment with kitchen”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan S
Reviews.Content: Great location. Great apartment, very high standard. Well equipped kitchen covering all the basic needs. Friendly and professional staff. Highly recommendable!!

Reviews.Title: “Large apartments, well furnished, great location on upper east side”
Reviews.Author: ZauberFoscolo
Reviews.Content: Just great overall. We went with a group discount for work reasons, and the place was fantastic. Will be back there again.

Reviews.Title: “best place to stay in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: Matthew J
Reviews.Content: The Marmara Manhattan offered a unique, wonderful perspective on NYC life - near enough to all the action of the city but removed enough to be peaceful. Moreover, the hotel is in effect a series of large apartments and I was blown away by the size of the one bedroom apartment. I could not recommend this more. Staff were charming and helpful and I cannot wait to return!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Apartment-Style Rooms”
Reviews.Author: kahkityoong
Reviews.Content: It's a little bit far from the touristic action but these are easily accessible via subway and cab anyway. I liked the feel of the quiet neighbourhood. The apartment style room was very comfortable, spacious well-apppointed. I ended spending more time than usual in a hotel room due to the heat during the day so I was pleased that it was so nice. Service was impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Grace M
Reviews.Content: My husband was having outpatient surgery at Mt. Sinai Hospital and we needed a place to stay that would be close since we would be in NYC for three days. The Marmara Manhattan fit the bill with the added benefit of having a kitchen! We found a market within walking distance and were able to prepare and eat our meals right at "home". The one disadvantage is that there is long term construction going on right outside the hotel and our first room was just above the site......not much sleep the first night. The staff was marvelous and when we requested a room change to a quieter location, they not only made the move, but upgraded us to a suite. I will return to this hotel again if we are in NYC. The price for a room with kitchen was less than a traditional hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you need to stay in this part of NYC”
Reviews.Author: PVH65
Reviews.Content: If you need to be near Mt. Sinai hospital, or someplace else in this neighborhood, this is a great hotel. I was upgraded fqrom a regular room to a Suite larger than most NYC apartments. Everything was spotless. There were some flaws: no room service, the tub didn't empty well, but overall, the room was great with a big comfy bed and flat screens TV. The room even had a balcony. This is very far from most NYC sights, so I don't think it would be a great pick for tourists, but if you need to be in this neighborhood, this is a great pick. Look for the chandeliers in the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great staff”
Reviews.Author: wetravellots101
Reviews.Content: End of week one, of four weeks, at the Marmara Manhattan. Like most places if you really wanted to you could find fault with it - but we don't want to. Sure there are things here that could be updated but everything has to be viewed in perspective. The critical thing in this life is to get, at minimum, what you pay for and keep your fingers crossed you might get better than what you payed for. We think the Marmara is delivering. It should be remembered that the staff in these style of hotels have to work with what they have and everything we have seen here tells us the staff take pride in their roles and their hotel. We have a great one-bedder on the 7th floor (a little close to the construction) that is clean, spacious and very well appointed. The common areas are kept spotlessly clean and the staff are courteous, attentive and friendly (especially Maureen on the front desk who is a real credit to the hotel). If you are looking for an extended stay in Manhattan in a good neighborhood and want real value for money, look no further than the Marmara. Yes there is construction at your doorstep - at the moment, thank God, it's not 24/7 they do stop in the night and have stopped on the weekend. We've stayed at plenty of 5 star hotels where the staff take less interest, but here from the Doorman on they do are fine job to welcome you. Well done Marmara

Reviews.Title: “Live like a local”
Reviews.Author: Maccyoz
Reviews.Content: We booked a two bedroom apartment for a one month stay in New York City in December. We were traveling as a family of five with three young adult daughters. The Marmara was perfect. After reading previous reviews I requested an apartment on a higher floor and was very happy with the apartment we were given on the 29th floor. The apartment was large and light with fabulous views from the East River to Central Park and I could see the top of the Empire Sate building from my bed! It was great to have a kitchen and very handy to have a large fridge. The utensils provided in the kitchen were very basic but a request for a kitchen knife was responded to immediately - even if the knife provided was quite blunt! The staff were always friendly and helpful. I enjoyed the location on the Upper East Side. It is a very residential neighborhood with plenty of restaurants,cafes and Delis to choose from. We always felt safe walking around even after dark. The subway is not too far away and the Green line was very handy when it came to getting around the city. It is also a pleasant walk to Central park and many of the Museums. Staying at the Marmara allowed us to experience living in New York as opposed to being in a tiny tourist hotel near Times Square and is a great option for families. We all have very fond memories of our time there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: mercy04
Reviews.Content: The staff is very helpful and nice. Always a smile and do you need anything if you approached the desk. You will not feel like you are staying in a hotel but like you live in NYC and this is your residence. We had a 3 bedroom 3 bath for X-mas week. The place was awesome with so much space because the bedrooms were big and the bathrooms. The best, you had a full kitchen and could make a breakfast before heading out which saves you money. The subway was a quick walk and its nice to get lost the best part and when you learn the routes you definitely feel like you live there. The Taxi rides were never over 20 (was holiday so a lot of traffic) and if you take the subway just take a Taxi back. Overall, if you want to experience NYC you don't need a fancy place because the time you spend in a room is only for sleep. However, this place is a clean, spacious, and attentive place that's inexpensive place to stay. Now, I would recommend a little TLC because it does show a little use the rooms like paint and new decor. Yet, for the time we were in the room it was nothing that bothered. Stay here if you want to experience living there, have a big group, and like space not the little hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Really cool place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mat R
Reviews.Content: OK, there are some drawbacks to this hotel - primarily the fact that it is really far from most of the action but we came here to be in the Upper East so it was perfect. If you want to be in the middle of Times Square or down in SoHo, expect long (expensive) taxi rides or some adventurous subway rides. Anyway, other than that, the only negative was the bed - not super comfy, a little over firm, but personally I slept like a rock. The hotel is neat and unique - it is the only hotel I've stayed in in Manhattan that has a full kitchen. Apparently it was formerly an apartment complex but that's a killer advantage because the rooms are HUGE in comparison to midtown boutique places - for $195 (cheap by Manhattan standards) we got a full living room, a west-facing balcony, a full kitchen (yea, I mean a stove, a full fridge, microwave, sink and all the utensils), a pull-out sofa bed AND a full separate bedroom with a queen bed, two panel TVs, DVD player, a good sized bathroom. And the decor is very tasteful - from the chandelier-lighted elevators to the very whimsical artificial-grass-walled atrium - and it has a substantial gym AND laundromat in the hotel. Awesome. Highly recommend this place, especially if you're keeping to the UES or if you need a lot of space (i.e. lots of family). Note - there is construction on Second Av (building a new subway) through 2016 but if you're above the 12th floor, you pretty much don't hear it.

Reviews.Title: “Functional and practical”
Reviews.Author: Patricia P
Reviews.Content: The hotel website suggests a degree of luxury that almost certainly place is not having said this negative generally the place is functional and a good base for a long stay in NYC. We were there for 18 nights and so the 2 bedroom apartment worked much better than a hotel with two teenagers. The accommodation was average not luxury and the photos on the website are a little deceiving in this regard. For Australians they should know that a "fully equipped kitchen" is very American in interpretation and therefore very basic. I am sure the pans I used had never been used before. A complaint about the maids throwing things out they should not have was never dealt with and was not taken seriously. The gym is very basic but there are plenty to choose from close by. There are heaps of stores to buy food from close buy and some restaurants but the better places need a cab or subway ride. It is walking distance to the major galleries and central park and close to a subway. If traveling with a large group, family or for a prolonged stay this place represents good value for money with daily room servicing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a Short or Long Stay”
Reviews.Author: YokohamaVisitor
Reviews.Content: My family needed a place to stay during our apartment renovation and what was supposed to be a month-long stay turned into two plus months. We were familiar with the area, which was a plus. The staff were unflailingly friendly and from what we could see, helpful to the numerous visiting families and groups staying at the hotel, from the doorman to the front desk staff. The doorman were always polite and helpful in getting a cab (which can be difficult because of the construction); the front desk staff recognized us each time we returned to the building. The large one bedroom was typical of East Side rental apartments we had lived in in the past, as compared to a "hotel" look, and it had pleasant decor and enough cooking equipment, plates, glasses and utensils so that you could treat the place as a home and do cooking and laundry on site, or go out to the plentiful bars and restaurants NYC has to offer. We had a high floor with a balcony with nice views. There's no getting around the Second Ave subway construction, particularly with the expected terminus being at 96th Street, has had a significant effect on Second Avenue, which the building faces, and it is difficult to cross the street and it is dirty and the construction apparently only stops on Sundays. Nevertheless for visitors who know their way around NY or know where they are going, there's no reason to spend much time in the neighborhood, and if you are using the place mainly as a place to sleep and eat breakfast in (Dunkin Donuts and a better than average bagel shop within 2 blocks) with the once or twice pizza or Chinese food delivery on a rainy night then this is very good indeed for the money and the space, especially if you are in a large group. The Lexington Ave subway is very close; the Second Ave bus stops move because of the construction work and probably is best left to the adventurous or the locals. The East River in the other direction is also very close, and worth a stroll (you can get to a riverside walk at 96th Street under the FDR) to remind yourself Manhattan is an island surrounded by water. Because we were a longer stay we had cleaning done weekly but had more than enough clean towels and supplies (soap, conditioner, etc) to last; and if we needed replenishing it was done promptly and courteously (there is no separate service elevator, so check ins/out, housekeeping, food and other deliveries share the two elevators with guests). The apartment was clean when we arrived and cleaned well enough each time. All in all Marmara Manhattan is very good for either a short or a long stay for those who want to experience visiting and living in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Home Sweet Home”
Reviews.Author: TrishHWashington_DC
Reviews.Content: If you desire space and a home-like feel, come to the Marmara! We stayed in Room 405--a one bedroom suite--for two nights in early December 2011. Although raining the entire time, the suite was bright and clean. There is one full bath in the bedroom and a convenient half-bath in the foyer. Shampoo, conditioner and other bath accessories were abundant. A hairdryer is stashed under the master bath sink. I was pleased with the white kitchen and all utensils/appliances one would need to cook. The coffee maker was welcome, as was the complimentary coffee and tea. The comfortable living room had a large flat-screen tv (Turkish station offered!), a desk, wi-fi, and dining area off to the side aided by a pass-through from the kitchen. The temperature is not themostatically controlled, but the manual switch is easy to use. With a lot of square footage and creature comforts, it truly felt like home. Because it's a suite hotel, it does not offer the usual hotel amenities like a restaurant or porter service. But the lobby staff are personable and helpful. The center lobby table offers guests free NY Times daily and other local magazines and guides. Stepping outside the hotel, SOMEDAY the new subway construction will offer quick rides downtown. However, the present subway stop is not far away (I took #6 Lex & 96th St). There are restaurants, delis, and a great drug store in the hotel vicinity and a good bakery where I ate breakfasts. A suite hotel is the perfect place to order in (especially when tired or inclement weather) and Chef Ho's delivers it's good Peking duck. The suite was very quiet, although we were there in rain with subway construction halted. I will stay here again. What the Marmara Manhattan affords is a break from the intense city frenzy--allowing one to recoup and start fresh the next day--at a very reasonable price. Value for money. Yes, I'd recommend it to a friend!

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not luxury like the name suggests...”
Reviews.Author: DanniC84
Reviews.Content: The Marmara was a disappointment for us... the list of pros and cons is very lopped sided with the cons far outweighing the pros. We stayed there in a suite on the 17th floor in the first week of December 2011 during the new subway construction right out our window. For starters our room was NOT clean as it should be... there were crumbs all on the kitchen bench and the previous vacationers hair on the sheets and in the bathroom. The entire hotel could do with a spruce up and good clean in order to gain the appropriate title of 'luxury'. About the only thing going for this place is the space in the rooms, but they are not the type of rooms you want to spend time in and certainly didn't look like the pictures. I wouldn't stay here again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “New York City Marathon Stay”
Reviews.Author: Thomtee
Reviews.Content: Satyed here for a week at the beginning of November. The staff were very friendly and welcoming, which was much appreciated after a long flight from Ireland. The 1 bedroom suite was fantastic and very spacious. Free wifi and the coffee welcome pack were a nice addition too! Location is pretty good - $10.00 from Times Square in a taxi, and about 10mins to the nearest subway. Nice restaurants, supermarkets and bars are all within 2 minutes walk. Yes, there is ongoing construction work outside, but this did not cause any inconvenience to us. We actually stayed an extra day in New York, but couldn't get another night at the Marmara. Splashed out on a night at the Hilton Hotel, and was not as impressed with their rooms in comparisson!! I will definitely be coming back, and would definitely recommend the Marmara Manhattan to anyone visiting New York .

Reviews.Title: “holiday”
Reviews.Author: cameliasagisman
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 10 day holiday in New York City. It was our first time staying in the Marmara Manhattan. Being used to luxery hotels in Midtown, but always with tiny rooms - we were thrilled to have a huge 1 bedroom apartment. We had a lovely view, the subway construction noise was not annoying at all. The stuff was always friendly and very helpfull. The walk to the subway was pleasant - and once they finish the works, it will be even easier to get into the subway. We were very happy with our stay and would definitely choose The Marmara Manhatten on our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel offers apartment-like accommodation on the upper east side with few of the usual hotel services such as a café.”
Reviews.Author: Water_Lily61
Reviews.Content: Our one-bedroom suite was spacious and had a full kitchen - larger than we had expected. While comfortable, the suite needed updating, eg, the broadloom had seen better days. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The free wi-fi was great. Don't bother using the room safe; it's not bolted to the wall or floor. One downside about the location - it's on the corner of 2nd Avenue where subway construction has been ongoing for years, so not pleasant to walk along, as well as noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Will come back soon.”
Reviews.Author: Soychai811
Reviews.Content: We loved the room, the location and the staff. However the bathroom needed a good scrub down. There were urine stains on the toilet. The counter needed cleaning as well. I was only there for 1 night otherwise I would have purchased some Clorox wipes and cleaned it myself.

Reviews.Title: “Better than a lot of Manhattan hotels”
Reviews.Author: TonyCon05
Reviews.Content: Modern, self catering room, with a big TV and an alarm clock radio with an ipod cradle.. nice. Bathroom is nice and big, kitchen is modern, and has a quality feel to it (ok ok, i only stored my water in the fridge and didn't tough the cooker - but it all looked very nice).. I liked this hotel. But it was St. Patricks day, and my vision was slightly blurry. The doorman was cool, and the receptionist was cooler. There's a shop not far away, 2 or 3 blocks west, and the subway station another block beyond that, beside a school. I probably lost out on the 'value' aspect of it, by getting drunk and staying somewhere else, only returning the following afternoon for a shower and a change of clothes, but hey, it was St. Patrick's Day

Reviews.Title: “Large spacious suites at reasonable prices”
Reviews.Author: liamblackmore
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in New York, and we didn't want to stay in an expensive, yet cramped room. This was a spectacular choice! The 1-bedroom suite is over 50 square meters: it includes a kitchen, dining table, a living area, 2 large flat screen TVs, iPod dock, and an expansive balcony which is perfect for hanging out at the end of a long day. Location-wise, it is situated in a quiet neighborhood. There are delis and restaurants around - perfect for take home food, when you just want to eat in. KEY FOOD Supermarket, a large grocery is just a 3 min. walk away. I saw people walking their dogs past midnight so i guess it's pretty safe. When we stayed here in June 2011, there was major construction going on along 2nd Ave., the road in front of the hotel. It is a 10 minute walk to the nearest subway station (Lexington & 96th). Just ask for a room on a high floor so you don't hear the traffic or the construction noise.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious apartments on the upper east side”
Reviews.Author: Jen16man
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a comfortable serviced apartment in a quieter area of Manhattan, this may be for you. The suites are large with well-equipped kitchens and a small balcony. For the size of the rooms, the price is pretty reasonable. The decor was a little faded, but the concierge is helpful and when you're in New York, you don't have to spend a lot of time indoors!

Reviews.Title: “suite place to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadagain5227
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I receetnly travelled to New York and were very happy with our 4 night stay at this hotel. Although it takes 2 subways to get to Times Square area the hotel is well situated in a safe neighborhood away from the hectic pace. It was close to the museums, central park, the east river, and the subway station which gave us easy access to Grand Central and the Bronx Zoo. The first room on the 7th floor was very noisy with construction, but the staff said they would try to get us up on a higher floor which they did after the first night. The 12th floor was much quieter and we even had a view of the east river from our suite. The suite had lots of space, was clean and the kitchen (that we didn't really use) was well stocked. We were quite surprised when they told us that there would be an extra $50.00 daily charge to put sheets on the hideabed! However, when we said we were not aware of that charge, the staff weere once again very accomadating and they kindly made up the hideabed the following day when they moved us to our new room, at no extra charge. We took a shuttle bus from the Newark airport to Grande Central then a cab from there to the hotel for a total of $60.00 for 2 people. However, on the way back we took a taxi to the Newark airport for a cost of $90.00! Great little Ialian restaurant a few blocks away, Osso Bucco which we would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for family”
Reviews.Author: j0999
Reviews.Content: The first thing to be commended are the Marmara staff - everyone greets you with a smile, day or night and so, that sets the tone for a happy holiday. They were also very helpful and accommodating especially the Reservations Supervisor E Akinci. Yes, there are no services eg dining but you are in proximity to so many local eat places - bagel, italian, chinese, you wouldn't need it. Grocery stores and laundromats are close by. There were 7 of us in the 3 bedroom corner apartment which has marvellous views of the city skyline, bridge and river. There were also 3 bathrooms (bonus) and a European laundry (extra bonus!). All the beds were comfortable with a king bed in the master bedroom, heaps of cupboard and storage space and a well equipped kitchenette. It did make us feel as if we were coming home every night after sight-seeing and shopping all day. There was also sufficient space for each of us to not get into each other's way. Location is far from the noise and bustle of Times Square but only 10 or so mins by subway. Construction noise didn't bother us then as we were on the 20+ floor. The bagel place around the corner is Excellent for breakfast - fast and inexpensive. A good place to start every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Not outstanding, but not disappointing either”
Reviews.Author: 50-State-Traveller
Reviews.Content: I love the idea of staying in an apartment when visiting my son in NYC. I've had good luck renting vacation rentals, but each one had something I wasn't crazy about (weak air conditioner, no elevator, lousy shower pressure) so this trip, I decided to go to the Marmara as being a "hotel" I figured everything would be in working order and they were running a special. Pros: Doorman, elevator, some friendly staff, quiet, spacious, 2 amazingly good air conditioners, nice flat screen televisions, safe in room, maid service daily. Cons: Bed was rock hard, kitchen poorly equipped, internet connection UNRELIABLE EVERY EVENING, one exceptionally unhelpful woman staff member with major tude. While the furnishings were nice and current, there were many signs of age in the kitchen and bath. The neighborhood is very nice and safe, and it's about 5 blocks to the subway station. (96th/Lex). While there is construction on 2nd, I didn't hear a thing from the 12th floor. Not sure if I'll stay here again, but I wouldn't rule it out. I've certainly stayed in much worse places!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice property on the upper eastside... with a few caveats”
Reviews.Author: Fazz
Reviews.Content: I recently enjoyed a long weekend at Marmara to attend an event. All the B&B’s were booked and I had a hard time finding a hotel in this area of the upper eastside. Marmara is a very low-key mixed use building of residence and guest rooms. The staff was excellent and very professional. There are a few things to consider when booking a stay at this property. I had envisioned the décor of the rooms would resemble what was shown on the web site. The pics aren’t at all what I got. I assume these are individual owners and the accommodations will vary widely room to room. My one bedroom suite had stark white walls, a couch and a very plain wood table with 4 wood chairs¬-¬-very austere. It didn’t bother me as I wasn’t going to be in the room much at all, but some folks may feel duped for some $450 a night after seeing the pics on the web site. The bed was very comfortable, Westin style, but that could also vary room to room. The Marmara has no services, not even ice. But right across the street was a delightful local grocery store opened 24 hrs a day, and they had ice and all the essentials etc. There’s a liquor store also within a block. There’s a great bagel spot and a few local bars with all the charm NYC has to offer. I enjoyed Off the Rails. I can’t recommend Ray’s pizza. The one thing to consider for some guests is that there is a subway station being built right outside your room which will continue for 4 years. I would not want to contribute to less commerce to this area affected by the construction, but it must be said It was very noisy during the weekdays. I didn’t hear construction noise from the bedroom, which is on the rear side of the unit—but I also travel with a fan to mask noise. And for me, I like the energy of the city and that’s part of the gestalt. But if my wife had been there, she would not have been a happy camper. One gripe is that I would only use 1 glass each day-no other dishes, and the maid would run the dishwasher. Seems like a waste of resources.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms and the nicest staff!”
Reviews.Author: ndshs2011
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, spacious room, a some noise, and not-so-bad location. I want to extend my special thanks to Elif Akinci who has been beyond helpful to us. The staff is really friendly and that made the whole difference for us.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to recover”
Reviews.Author: FlaviaA2011
Reviews.Content: We went to NY to undergo medical treatment, initially to stay just for a month, but ended up staying more than two months (from June 17th to August 23rd) at the Marmara Manhattan Hotel. We cannot thank ALL the staff enough. They were always extremely kind to us, and always tried to help and tend to every little request we had. There was no occasion in which our requests were not satisfied. Unfortunately, there is some subway construction around and, because of that, some noise, but at least in our floor when we shut the windows there was no noise at all. There are many great restaurants and supermarkets around that area, which is also close to many hospitals, including the one we went to to have treatment. While it doesn't have a restaurant, it has a very good kitchen with all the necessary for people to cook. It is a very clean and nice place to stay. We are feeling way better now, and we have to thank that hotel's staff for helping us do so! I would name many of them right now, to thank them individually, but I don't know if I can do so here.... Anyway, thank you very much, Marmara Manhattan, for providing us a home away from home! When we go back to NY on vacation, we will certainly try to stay at Marmara Manhattan again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible and unpolite"”
Reviews.Author: Maurizio B
Reviews.Content: The Marmara Manhattan Hotel is not a luxury hotel. We have spent 9 nights (three more than planned because of Irene Hurricane) and the experience was not nice. First of all, there was a lot of noise because of road work. We lived 2 days with a terrible, continuous noise all the day and all the night then we asked to have a different apartment. They moved us from the sixth to the tenth floor but the situation did not change significantly. Second, there is not any kind of service like bar, restaurant, coffee shop. Third, the apartment was not really clean. The moquet was dirty with all kinds of stains. Fourth, the kitchen had few instruments to cook. In addition, during our stay, for most of the time only one of the two elevators was operative. In addition, due to the emergengy of Irene Hurricane we were obliged to stay three nights more than planned and they proposed us a fare that was much more higher than that we paid for the first six night. Scandalous. Finally, they did not accept a money transfer through internet banking and I was obliged by an unpolite manager to pay cash leaving me in a big trouble due to the hurricane emergency

Reviews.Title: “A great place for a family!”
Reviews.Author: CSL63
Reviews.Content: Our family of five stayed here for a week's vacation in Manhattan, and this was the way to do it! With five of us, including two teenagers, we needed at least two rooms and two baths, and two hotel rooms in a decent hotel will completely break the bank for most families. After researching here, we chose the Marmara. It was a nice place! The location was a little farther north than I anticipated, although in all fairness I didn't really think about it enough - that one's one me. The location worked just fine, though. To get to the subway was about 2 short blocks and 2 long blocks - uphill to the subway. Bus stop was on 2nd, across the street and one block down. By NYC standards, subway was close. By Houston standards, where everyone drives cars all the time, and we had a couple of bad knees, it was a little farther, but actually still worked out just fine. Check in was easy - there's a small desk in the lobby, and they were ready for us. There are two elevators, so sometimes you have to wait a minute, but not too long. (Look up in the elevator!). The halls are very dark, though. Once you get used to it, it's not as startling, but there are only a couple of small lights on each floor, and the walls are painted dark gray. The rooms are nice and spacious, tho. We had a two bed / two bath, that had apparently not been remodeled. The carpet was older, but the furniture was all fine. The entryway had a parquet floor that needed to be refinished / replaced. We did get a peak into another unit during the week, and saw that it had the newer, nicer carpet. Otherwise, our unit had the feel of an actual apartment, except that all the colors were very neutral, and there wasn't as much artwork on the walls as a private apartment would have. Living room and each bedroom had a nice flat screen TV. Sofa and chairs in the living room were nice and comfortable. Sofa bed feels like a sofa bed - not great, but it worked. King bed in the master and two twin beds in the second bedroom were all comfortable. Bathrooms worked just fine. Master bath had jacuzzi jets, but we never used them. Men will notice that the toilets are located a little too far back, and there isn't enough room for the seat to stay up by itself - poor planning on someone's part. Kitchen had service for eight, good size fridge - everything you'd need for a short term stay. For our drinks, cereal, pop tarts, and snacks, it was more than enough. There was a little confusion between the small trashcan and the larger recycling bin, but we figured that out after a couple of days. In the entry hall was a stackable washer and dryer, but we never had the opportunity to use them. Balcony was a great view! we had a corner unit on the 19th floor, so we had great views! Everyone spent some time out there enjoying the view. Housekeeping was generally fine, but there seemed to be a shortage of shampoo and conditioner. More than once we had to ask for more after housekeeping had been there. Closet space was great, and the hangers were nice. The safe was a typical hotel safe, but was not bolted to the floor. I don't know if they're all that way, but at least nobody stole ours while we were there. This is not a full service hotel, so no one should expect things like restaurants and room service, or a pool. However, there are numerous decent restaurants within a block, and hundreds more a short hop away, so we didn't see that as a problem. If you're looking to sit in your room and don't want to go out, that might be a problem. Speaking of restaurants, people have mentioned Nick's. It's right across the street, and it's fine, but not outstanding. It's nice and convenient, but there's a lot of very good Italian in New York. This works 'cause it's close, but nothing to write home about. There are small grocery stores nearby, as well as pharmacies, and a liquor store, so you should be okay for whatever you need within a block or so. All in all, I would recommend this hotel again. If I go again and don't have the whole family, I would probably stay at a more traditional hotel down near Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Marmara”
Reviews.Author: moac4
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we have stayed at the Marmara and it was as clean and friendly and convenient as the first time. The views are great and the apartment is very clean, bright and spacious with all the basics. . THe beds are very comfortable - as are the pillows. We had our 1 year old and they provided a crib with VERY clean bedding - and the doorman was so helpful and patient helping us unload and load all our gear in and out of the car when we arrived and left. The front desk staff are always friendly and the location is convenient for doing things on the upper east side. It is a great value, we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Upper East Side Base for Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: JUSTINATKIN
Reviews.Content: We stayed in apartment 7B for 4 nights / 5 days. It was well equipped with everything that we needed including free wi-fi which helped us to book the various NYC attractions online and thus avoid some queues. We chose the location as a friend recommended that this was a much quieter area to stay, however we did not find this to be an issue as we made good use of the excellent value NYC 7 day travel pass which gives unlimited access on metro and buses for just $27! There is a bus stop 'downtown' just 2 minutes walk from the apartment, whilst 'uptown' buses stop on 1st and 3rd avenue at 96th street - no more than a good 5 minutes walk. The reception staff were very helpful and the apartment cleaned and serviced daily. In summary a very good base.

Reviews.Title: “we found a great hotel who answered our expectations”
Reviews.Author: manouschka
Reviews.Content: we had a great time we asked for a room 14th floor or higher (to have a view) and we were on the 14th floor. The room was very nice, wide livingroom with flatscreen, little kitchen with everyhting you need. The bedroom was very nice too. Large bed nice flatscreen tv clean sheets and NO bedbugs!! The bathroom is a a bit small compared to the rest of the suite but very good. Toilet, bath/shower , sink and big mirror If you are very picky you may not like as we did cause there some bad paintwork done in the bathroom but almost not noticable and a curtain in the livingroom was a bit damaged but thats not something that bothers us. The terrace has a nice view and even there were works going on in the street below we almost didnt hear a thing during our stay We recommand this place and will go back. Staff is very friendly. PS when you order a cab to go back to the airport please mention you wan't a yellow cab ohterwise you'll be charges 65dollars in stead of 45 dollars just to be in a private cab that doesn't offer anything more than the yellow one Voila i hope you'll enjoy your stay there im wondering when we'll be able to go back ...soon i hope :-)

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what were after”
Reviews.Author: cash01
Reviews.Content: The brief to find accommodation suitable for 6 women for a week was proving difficult until we stumpbled across Marmara. 3 large bedrooms - we were willing to share with 2 king size beds and 2 singles - 3 bathrooms a great living area and fantastic 27th floor views. There was also a washer and dryer in the apartment which really made us feel at home. Some habits die hard! The location was fine with a good subway line close and with grocery and grog shops nearby we were set. The staff at reception were extremely helpful to us. They were happy to suggest places to shop, sightsee and eat. They also printed out some travel instructions to help us get to Brooklyn which made it easy and in general were accommodating of any request we made - thanks to all the staff who looked after us. It was great to have free WiFi although the connection was a little tempremental while we were there - not sure if this is usual. Would recommend Marmara to anyone who wanted to feel more at home than a hotel room can provide. Would also recommend Nicks Italian across the road - great food, great friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in NYC, the hotel has everything you need”
Reviews.Author: CORREGIOE
Reviews.Content: The Marmara is a very good hotel in NYC, well located near the mainly avenues in the city and the subway green line. The services are very good, try it.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Cutesie”
Reviews.Author: stephbaker79
Reviews.Content: Service from the door was great and the staff was very friendly. I requested a room with a view and was giving the 18th floor and was informed at the desk it is a smoking floor. I was nervous about that (because as a non-smoker I hate the smell), but the lady said, she didnt think even if I was sensitive to smoke that I would smell it and she was right. My room was great and the amenities are really nice. If you like feeling like you are home this is the place for you. Great Location for great resturaunts...Loved it. The only thing that could be better was my shower head and shower accessories could be better and the Marmara should offer free parking if you stay there...but erething else was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelieveable find: Pet Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: savingracesarah
Reviews.Content: As I look to recommend a NYC hotel for family the Marmara comes to mind. How fortunate I was to grab this deal from a hotel room supplier I will never know. But traveling with a teen and small dog I was astounded at the luxury I enjoyed for the unbeatable price < $160. I booked a studio and received a one bedroom with complete kitchen, living room and terrace. Clean, safe, accessible to services, and quiet although the subway work was below. This was a stay I will always remember.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Graduation Get Together”
Reviews.Author: Humarock_Travelers
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay to house us, my elderly parents and my sister and her one year old. We were so happy with the Marmara. The three room suite, while spare, was clean, the beds were comfortable and our views of the triboro bridge and the empire state building every night were great. We loved being able to have breakfast in the apartment and for everyone to be able to take NYC at their own pace. The staff was very helpful and attentive. We had an "at home" party immediately following graduation and they provided champagne glasses for everyone. Other than a glitch with their credit card machine on check out, everything was great. There is no attached parking to the hotel and nearby parking is pricey - to be expected on the upper east side.

Reviews.Title: “Please Remove the word "Luxury" from your Hotel description”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixWestin
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 bedroom/3 bath suite, based on the Hotel Website description. This property is in no way a luxury hotel, and should not be advertised as such. The photos we took are worth a thousand words, see for yourself...carpets are so badly stained and worn that they are actually black in the corners and behind doors in each room. No one in our group would take off their shoes. Stains and cigarette burns on furniture. The extra blanket in one bedroom closet had long black hairs in it. Bathrooms were old and tired, and the doors to the vanity cabinets were torn off the hinges. The strong odor of the hallway and rooms are similar to an old gym. When we first brought these concerns up with the front desk, we were given a blank stare and an explanation by a young lady that the reason for the stains and smell are due to the fact that they are a pet-friendly hotel and have to use strong chemicals to remove the (urine??). We asked for another room and again, were given an attitude that nothing could be done. This was the best they had to offer. So, I assume that we were walking in pet urine sprayed down with a chemical and that made it okay? On the other hand, the cleaning staff were very good, and in fact attempted to scrub out some of the carpet stains, but that was a futile attempt. After 5 days, we could no longer deal with the poor lack of concern from the front desk staff (and the smell), so we decided to move to another hotel for the rest of the trip. This is when we finally heard from the Manager. The location of the hotel is not in the "Upper East Side" close to upscale shops and restaurants. There is road construction surrounding the hotel making for dusty and difficult walking. Check your maps carefully prior to selecting this area. This hotel has great potential to be very good. The floor plans for a large hotel room with a small kitchen are a great idea in New York. We do hope that they seriously remodel or change their description to a truthful and accurate description.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: TravelMom56
Reviews.Content: My husband and I brought our 16-yr old son to NY for sightseeing, and we wanted the impossible--Manhattan, spacious, economical. Marmara fit the bill! We reserved a one-bedroom suite, but upon arrival, we were told that we'd been upgraded to a two-bedroom suite. Suite? It was an apartment! On the 17th floor, we had floor-to-ceiling windows that overlooked Manhattan to the south and the East river to the east. We had two bedrooms, two bathrooms (one with a whirlpool bathtub), a full kitchen, living room and dining room. Our son loved hanging out on the balcony and watching the street life below. We couldn't have asked for nicer accommodations for the price. The apt's decor was a little tired, but it was spotlessly clean, well equipped, spacious, and in a great location. We were close to the subway at 96th or 86th and Lexington for easy access to everything in the city. We were blocks away from the Museum Mile, a main reason for our visit, and we had our choice of neighborhood restaurants. Nick's, an Italian restaurant across the street, was especially good, as was Sabor a Mexico on 1st Ave between 90 and 91. The staff at the Marmara were kind and helpful and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it or to return to it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in a perfect city.”
Reviews.Author: tifosidave
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife, our son and her parents. The convenience of the kitchen facilities were perfect as we were travelling with a 4 month old. The first thing we noticed was the wonderful service from the desk staff, very friendly and helpful. When we got to our room on the 23rd floor we were all impressed by the size and facilities available, it really was a home from home all topped of with a view of the Empire State Building (which unfortunately I don't get in my home!). We have to say that there was no issues with cleanliness as our room was immaculate with the bed linen and towels changed regularly. The location was good, although it will be fantastic when the new subway line is finished as it will be 2 blocks from a new station. And although there is construction noise it didn't affect us with the doors and windows shut, and with air con we didn't need them open anyway. But it is only a short walk to the subway, and Central Park is only a few blocks away. Even midtown is walkable and you go past some nice shops and restaurants. Everything you need is close by, plenty of little supermarkets to get food and drink. Restaurants closeby are good value and good food. I cannot recommend this hotel enough, it was everything we needed and hoped for and from our point of view there were no downsides to it.

Reviews.Title: “Top service after a long flight”
Reviews.Author: Cleosmum
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend had booked a 'TWIN' room through Wotif.com - when we arrived from a long wary flight we were told by the Marmara Manhattan Hotel that they do not offer twin rooms (mistake was made by wotif.com). Thankfully I had printed out our booking confirmation of a twin room. We asked to speak to the Manager about this problem, who was nothing short of wonderful with us - friendly and accommodating - and offered us a 2 bedroom apartment on the 20th floor for no extra cost. The Manager (rightly) told us she would take the issue up with wotif.com and assured us that this was not our mistake. What fantastic service, and very welcome after such a long flight. The hotel is only 2 blocks away from the subway, and about 4 blocks from Central Park. We strolled into mid-town via Lexington Avenue which was well worth a stroll/look. On the corner of Lexington and 94th Street you will find 'The Barking Dog' which was a nice place to go for dinner/lunch/breakfast or to just have a glass of sangria and watch the city go about its buisness. Hotel was modern, clean and comfortable, the 20th floor was quiet and the views were lovely. Staff made us feel welcome. Free WiFi definitely attracted us to stay here - it's the little things that count. COMFY beds! Would highly recommend this hotel to stay at if you are considering it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room and view”
Reviews.Author: rory83123
Reviews.Content: HI, Stayed here 4 nights in 20c in on may the 13th. Staff very friendly. Room was huge with massive balcony looking out at ny on one side and the river on the other. Very happy with service. Thank you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Room and Value”
Reviews.Author: ItsOK
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel located on the upper east side and an excellent value. We stayed in Room 10C, in the middle of the hotel, with a south facing view. The room was a studio efficiency with a complete kitchen. The room was exceptionally clean with a kitchen table with two chairs, desk, desk chair, side chair and very comfortable bed. Sufficient closet space was provided and the bath had sufficient storage area as well. The room had a large screen Sony TV with cable and a secure WPA wireless router was provided. We occupied the room for 6 nights. The room had two locks on the door and a chain. The smoke detector looked a little aged and there were no room fire sprinklers. There were two elevators available and two emergency exits. The staff was very polite and helpful; and the maid service was very good. The room was comfortable and suited our needs. We did not spend a lot of time in the room and were out in the city most of the time. The hotel is close to the number six subway on Lexington, within walking distance of central park, groceries, restaurants and pubs. It was easy to hail a cab if needed.

Reviews.Title: “The most spacious apartment in NYC - surely!”
Reviews.Author: KMac1971
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with for 8 nights - holiday with my Dad. Second year in a row we travelled to NYC - last year stayed on Upper West Side - better spot but this apartment was a much better set up - great kitchen, bedrooms separated by entrance/living area so very quiet. Staff were very good, especially the doormen. It was also great having a washing machine/dryer in the apartment for that length stay, and even though the weather was a bit chilly we enjoyed having the balcony. Unfortunately the street noise due to the 2nd avenue subway construction is pretty bad - but I got used to it after the second night - I think Monday mornings in particular are bad as the delivery trucks are all coming in from off the island etc. Location - a brisk 5 min walk to the subway, but lots of great eateries within 1 or 2 min walk, and a couple of handy supermarkets for self catering. Next time I think I'd prefer to stay back in the 70's but for value for money and spaciousness this was great. And we very much appreciated the free WIFI in planning each days activities on our laptop!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect starting point for exploring NYC”
Reviews.Author: IngridReiseglad
Reviews.Content: We met a really serviceminded personnel, this is always a good start for a stay! Further on we got a really nice room - an appartment really - on 19th floor, and the view was spectacular! Walking south on 2nd Ave you find breakfast and dinner easily. Nearness of Central Park for fresh air, quick access to museums, and short way to Lexington Ave for shopping makes this hotel a really good starting point. If one doesn't want all the walking we did, getting on buses is no problem, and Subway is only some blocks away. We slept really well in comfortable beds. The kitchenette was well equipped - with fridge, freezer and cooking possibilities. Please note that we upgraded the room as we wanted to stay as high up as possible and this we find was well spent money. I really would recommend this hotel for other travellers when purpose is exploring NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location and a Good Night's Sleep”
Reviews.Author: LaSpinachi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with a young relative, spent three nights at this very lovely hotel. The welcoming and ever-smiling staff could not have been more helpful, and our two bedroom, two full-bath suite was enormous, and had a view of the East River, as well as a terrace. The beautiful beds were extremely comfortable, and best of all the hotel is quiet at night - there was very little street noise and it made an excellent night's sleep possible - so rare in NYC. Amongst the attractions we visited were the Metropolitan Museum of Art and the The Cloisters, so the Marmara was ideally located for these sights. I have already recommended the Marmara to friends and will certainly return there - it exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Upper East Side atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: duegironi
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Marmara Luxory Apartments Hotel during end of years vacations from 01.01.2010 until 01.09.2010 (9 days). The apartments are very beautiful, clean and the staff of the hotel is nice. We booked an appartment at 16th floor (1 bedroom, 1 living room + 1 kitchen & bathroom) and we had very beautiful view of upper east side. The hotel offers for free wireless connection and a small gym... the cooking room is well equipped and near the hotel there are four supermarket and a lot of restaurants/fast food. The hotel is just 2 block from subway station (96st - line 6) and eventually there is a bus stop just next to the hotel. I think that this hotel is a good compromise with position and cost if you plan to stay in new york for more than 4-5 days.

Reviews.Title: “BEST BANG FOR YOUR BUCK....PERFECT!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: raven6
Reviews.Content: It couldn't have been better! From the moment we arrived, the staff was very very friendly. The response time for any favor (forgetting my room key....needing more towels or coffee) was immediate. The bed was very comfortable. The kitchen was great. This is an apartment like room. Nice size living room, much larger bedroom than any i've stayed at in new york. The only downside is the location because you need to take a cab or the nearby subway to get to the shopping but it's an easy, direct line. The cab fares still make the room most affordable than any other hotel i've ever stayed in Midtown. So, if you're going to new york to have fun with friends or your children, it is a great getaway. I honestly can't say enough good things about this hotel. Compared to Marriott, W, Helmsley, Essex, this one far outshines their tiny rooms and high prices.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ripley66
Reviews.Content: Outstanding hotel., pretty much a one bedroom apartment., complete with kitchen, posh bedroom and fold out sofa-sleeper. Very clean and quiet., although the noise from the outside can get pretty loud., just ask for a room on a higher floor. Lots of great restaurants and bars just blocks away. Safe neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Home in the City!”
Reviews.Author: SailingCats
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Marmara - the first was last year - and we will be back! We had a one bedroom suite, which was bright, airy and spacious, especially for NYC. The staff is helpful and friendly. We stayed on the 12th floor, and were not bothered by any street or other noise - it was remarkably quiet. The full kitchen is wonderful, and comes with a dishwasher. Having the ability to eat breakfast in is lovely, although there is a nice place that serves breakfast nearby (Barking Dog). A small market on 2nd Ave is 2 minutes away. There is also an average italian restaurant across the street, which is great for nights when you are tired from the day. The area is more residential than touristy, but cabs are plentiful, the subway is a 5 minute walk away, and the museums are a 20 minute walk. This last stay our bed was extremely hard, and was (for us) uncomfortable. The benefits far outweighed that one complaint, however!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable but with some minor problems”
Reviews.Author: ahberman
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed for 7 nights at the Marmara during February of 2011. We booked a one-bedroom suite with kitchen and were given a very pleasant suite on the 12th floor. Generally we were pleased with the atmosphere and fittings of the room, particularly the modern design with a slight oriental twist. The staff were courteous and very helpful at all times. The problems we had were: a) a very strong smell of chlorine when we began our stay; we asked the staff to make sure no chlorine was used during our stay and they desisted so by the 3rd or 4th day the smell was gone. But it took quite a long time to disappear and both my sister and I are sensitive to chemical smells and think the management should look over the types of chemicals used in the cleaning process, using preferably ecologically compatible products with no lingering fragrance; b) the sofa bed, on which my sister slept, was ok to sleep on but not too comfortable. It was also a bit hard to open and we had to ask for assistance two or three times (a staff member promptly came up to help us but it was a bit inconvenient); c) the heating seems a bit antiquated and the room became rather dry so we found ourselves turning the heating on and then off for the night; d) at the end of our stay we split the cost on two credit cards but the system produced a mix of our names and cards - this is not acceptable if one needs to submit costs as business expenses. The system should be reviewed and adapted to split costs, which are probably not all that uncommon. Otherwise, we were very pleased with our stay and were very comfortable. One word of warning - bring your earplugs as the noise from the streets wafted efficiently up to our room on the 12th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: EmilyTx
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews, but felt compelled to share my experience at this hotel. My husband needed to undergo open heart surgery at Mt Sinai, and this was one of the hotels recommended by the hospital. I was torn between Marmara and Wales Hotel, which was a bit closer, but after my experience on the phone with the Wales staff (that's a whole other story!) I chose the Marmara, and was so glad that I did. I stayed in a one bedroom apartment on the 21st floor with my teenaged daugthter. The apartment was scrupulously clean, well appointed, a corner unit with generous windows in the living area, and even a small balconey. The Kitchen was fully stocked with a service for four. The staff was incredibly kind and caring. What could have been a frightening and lonely experience was mitigated by the attitude in the hotel. I had booked a 4 night stay, but when my husband needed to stay for 7 nights, my stay was extended on a night per night basis. After long, tiring days at the hospital it was wonderful to return to the hotel, and greeted warmly by the doorman and front desk staff. It even felt as if I had a pied a terre in the city, and I would love to return to take advantage under better circumstances. The walk to the hospital was very doable, even though it was one of the coldest and snowstormiest weeks in NYC history. The only criticism that I have is that the windows are not very well insulated, and leaked some cold air, and the Manhattan noise was perhaps more than it should have been. But cranking up the heat and a pair of earplugs fixed that, and the linens were lovely and luxurious. All in all, I am very grateful for this hotel, would come again, and recommend to anyone who needs to stay in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bice4
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in this hotel. Our suit was a two bedroom suite on 25th floor. The location is very good, it was very easy to go to midtown and when you come back, you feel like you are at home. The rooms are very nice, comfortable and very very clean. Staff is very friendly and kind. Do not hesitate to stay here. You will like it.

Reviews.Title: “New York Apartment style living.”
Reviews.Author: clovellyjel
Reviews.Content: Our group of 12 family & friends recently stayed 10 nights in two 3-bedroom apartments in the Marmara Manhattan. What a gem of a find! Loads of space for an Upper East Side accommodation, TVs in every room, full kitchen & laundry plus free WiFi. At the end of a long day sight seeing we would all gather in one apartment & share our stories of the day over a quiet coffee of a chilled glass of champers! The walk to the subway was fine & it's a great line to be on. There are shops within a short walking distance where you could get groceries, alcohol, pizza, magazines, freshly baked bagels, a pharmacy & even a 24 hour gym! We did all this in the snow & it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value: Great Hotel/Apartment”
Reviews.Author: Jamieb86
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Marmara for a week and would highly recommend the hotel. From the minute the taxi dropped us off at the airport, our luggage was taken care of and the reception staff were very friendly and polite. Check in was swift and we got a room on the 7th floor. One thing to bear in mind about New York is the noise, at night there is still a substantial amount of traffic and other noise, we were ok, but could still hear quite a lot, other reviewers asked for a higher room, but I felt the noise was bearable as I expected it. The room itself is huge, (bedroom suite) we had a double bed and a further bedroom with a bathroom, kitchen and large TV's in the living area. I was told that for New York this was great! The area is reasonable, there are roadworks just now for the 2nd avenue subway, a 5 minute walk down any avenue and there are plenty of lovely restaurants and bars to choose from. The subway is only two blocks away and gets you downtown in 10-15 mins, however most of the time we walked downtown to look around the avenues. All in all a great hotel, they provided us with good places to eat and were even willing to sort out a private transfer to the Airport, which was cheaper than the taxi. Each room has its own free wi-fi which was an added bonus! Would definately go back and stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: haivee
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the beginning of December on my first trip to NYC with a friend, and I loved it! We stayed in the one bedroom suite and it was beautiful, spacious, clean and very comfortable. We had a good look around at prices when we were looking to book a hotel, and for the same price that we paid at Marmara, all that was being offered were shabby hotel rooms. So it was good value for money =) The room we stayed in had a little balcony, although it was too cold in December to really stand outside on it. And it was only a few blocks away from a subway station, which made getting around the city very easy. The only mishap that happened was that the rail holding the shower curtain fell down, but after a quick call to reception, a worker was promptly sent up to fix it. Also, there wasn't much cutlery in the kitchen, but we didn't use the kitchen anyway as we ate out most of the time. Overall, it was a fantastic place to stay and I would definitely recommend Marmara to anyone who doesn't want to stay in a typical hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Next time i will prefer again”
Reviews.Author: Hulya965
Reviews.Content: We came to new york city for the holidays, and we stayed at The Marmara Manhattan and it was great. thank you for your hospitality. Special thanks to Mr.Mete ,Mr.Mehmet and all the other staff. We recommend everybody who would come to New York.

Reviews.Title: “The best place for families to stay on the East Side”
Reviews.Author: morhon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel in November and we really enjoyed the location and the friendly personnel. The one drawback was the construction on 2nd Ave but the staff were able to upgrade us to one of the upper floors, and that made a huge difference. The accommodations were spacious and the kitchen well equipped. I can't imagine that there would be a better place to stay with a family. The walk to the subway was easy, and there are a few markets nearby that make food shopping simple. We will definitely consider staying there the next time we go to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice for everyone looking for more space”
Reviews.Author: Katrin70
Reviews.Content: - Enjoyed the spacious living room! - Free wifi - tv in every bedroom plus an additional one in the living room - fully equipped kitchen - friendly and helpful front desk

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again without a doubt!”
Reviews.Author: Jcbiking
Reviews.Content: Great location and it was very nice. Not luxurious, but great anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely apartment, friendly and helpful service”
Reviews.Author: AussieClare
Reviews.Content: Clean lovely apartment (we stayed in the standard one bed). Two LCD TVs, one massive! Bigger kitchen than my own - full with oven, hob, microwave, fridge, dishwasher, toaster, coffee machine - everything for eating in. Free wireless internet. Excellent service from front desk and doorman. Location good for central park and the Met/Guggenheim museum. Not good if you want to eat out downtown- it takes an hour on the train to get to the lower east side. Subway is 4 blocks or 7-10 min walk. Nice view from building of city - try and get a room as high up as possible as the city is extremely noisy at night and building not well sound proofed. Dogs are allowed and the one down the hall was annoying - barking all day and night - good thing I had earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: FulyaOzkan
Reviews.Content: The best hotel I've ever stayed in upper east side.The best staff ever.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent apartment, like home from home”
Reviews.Author: Jan0808
Reviews.Content: The Marmara is a great place to stay. We had a one bedroom suite, which was ideal as we have a teenage daughter. She was able to sleep on the sofa bed in a separate room. A very high level of cleanliness and a super comfy bed! I guess the sheets and pillowcases are luxury egyptian cotton as it was like sleeping on a cloud. Having a kitchen was great too, especially for breakfast and hot drinks, and also chilling wine! Approx. 10 mins to the nearest subway and around 10-15 minutes ride to Central Station (an awesome building). I would recommend to anyone. A tip for bargains in clothes, shoes, jewellery etc is a department store called Century 21, located in the Financial District. Spent hours there!!

Reviews.Title: “we feel ourselves like at home.”
Reviews.Author: mdincer
Reviews.Content: when we want to back to hotel, all of us say lets go home and relax.metro very close.Taxi in new york very cheap and easy to find. whenever we come new york again we will definitely stay THE MARMARA MANHATTAN.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, and extremely comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: BellaGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: The Marmara was a great find. Five us stayed in a 3 bedroom apartment. How do you get 3 bedrooms and 3 bathrooms in New York, with lounge dining and kitchen and washer dryer for the price. The views were wonderful downtown and down to the river. We had such a great time there, it was just perfect. Having 5 adults together it was wonderful that we all had our space, without feeling we were living on top of each other for 5 days. The staff were all very helpful. Also our daughter is and athlete so she really appreciated the gym facilities. Marmara you made our stay in New York for our sons birthday just wonderful. Thank You

Reviews.Title: “Charming and extremely helpful front desk staff made our stay a great experience.”
Reviews.Author: gillie13
Reviews.Content: Rooms were huge and well appointed. Minor problems were quickly attended to. Televisions in living room and bedroom were large and the unit had cable and wi-fi service. Nice people made this a very pleasant stay. One block away from the NYC Marathon was an unexpected extra.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for families”
Reviews.Author: haarlemfamily
Reviews.Content: When you bring kids to the Big Apple, you need space and that is what this hotel is all about. We opted for a three bedroom apartment, which turned out to be enormous compared to other NY Hotels. Having a kitchen, a living room and en suite bathrooms is all you require when travelling with a family (including my mother in law). Paying $600 a night (average) will get you only some closet space in a midtown hotel. But here we had a complete apartment. Location wise, for us it was perfect. Only 2 blocks from the subway, and a short walk to Central Park. Our kids love it (but I also have to mention that they are used to walking a lot). Great views from the 27th floor, Empire State, East River but I guess that was also because we had the 3 bedroom. Staff ware very nice. Do not however get the taxi service from the hotel it was a total rip off. When you arrive at for instance JFK, just wait a little and get a yellow cab. One more thing, bring earplugs. Construction is ongoing, and will be apparently until 2015, for a new subway line. But boy if that is finished this hotel will be a definite winner. We couldn't be bothered by the construction and absolutely loved this place.

Reviews.Title: “Long stay hotel in the Upper East Side of Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: CAJ_TA
Reviews.Content: The Marmara is a long stay hotel in the northern part of Manhattan's Upper East Side. It is on the corner of 2nd Avenue and 94th Street, which means it is currently (as of late 2010) affected by the second avenue subway construction. The staff are friendly and the rooms are large. There are a lot of places nearby to eat, and the nearest subway station at 96th Street on the Lexington line is a brisk five minute walk. From the upper floors there are some great views down across Manhattan, including the Empire State. If you want to stay in Manhattan for a week or longer, it is a great place and well worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “Great Space”
Reviews.Author: luckywhentraveling
Reviews.Content: We had booked a studio at this apartment hotel and got a one bedroom suite. It was very roomy, clean and comftorable. There is alot of construction going on outside but that did not really bother us. It is probably as far north as you want to go but we did feel safe. There is an all night pizza place and a little grocery right across the street. It is just a short walk to Lexington where there are at least a million restaurants! You are close to bus and subway stops. On the subway you are not more than 15 minutes to most places including Times Square and the Theatre District. Otherwise you can walk to Central Park , alot ol the museums, restaurants and some shopping. The staff was very nice. All that said we will look for another location. It is a little out of the way and as I said earlier the location is not the best but, if you are looking for alot of room in a clean space this is great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent apartment hotel, spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: AboFaisal
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my wife and two young children (6 & 4) in one bedroom apartment, this is not a hotel, it is a self catering serviced apartment and the building is refurbished from being a residential apartment building. Location: good in upper east side but not central if you are looking to be in Midtown or near attractions like times square or 5th ave. , the area is abit residential but there are nearby grocery, restaurants and shops outside the hotel in 2nd Ave., Room: it is in a good shape and the kids where sleep in the sofa bed in the living room, it has a full stocked kitchen open to the living and a dining table, it fits our need perfectly. the apartment is spacious and serviced daily and kept clean. it was in 5th floor overlooking the 2nd avenue and i was afraid of the noise from construction of the new subway station but I slept well and the noise was minimal. Services: there is no room service or restaurants in hotel (as I think!!) however you can order from the nearby restaurants who deliver it to your apartment. wirless internet is available for free and there are 3 PCs in the lobby to access internet. the hotel is really excellent for anyone looking for extra space and feel like home and reasonable price (comparing to other hotels in NYC at least during my stay), those who are looking for service or best location this is NOT for you. finally the I liked the complementry Ice tea in the lobby, nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and amenities for an NYC trip”
Reviews.Author: awilson21
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend for 4 nights and so we got one of the Superior One Bedroom suites. It was really spacious and the full kitchen was great. The room we had (15D) had an ensuite off the bedroom and another toilet in off the hallway, plenty of closet space, a dining room and a huge flatscreen and DVD player in the sitting room as well as a smaller flatscreenTV in the bedroom. The printer/scanner/fax was a great addition as having a boarding pass printed was a huge help. There is a wireless router for each suite. Only thing missing from the room was a full length mirror. The reception staff were very nice, they made a couple of small errors with credit card authorisation but nothing major. The location is great - about 3 blocks from the subway, grocery stores, wine/liquor shops, delis, ATMs and a few takeaways all in the surrounding few blocks. Getting a taxi on 2nd was never a problem and the hotel itself is very easy to find as it is almost on the corner. Compared to the last time I stayed in Manhattan in a short term let apartment this has definite advantages - mainly space and service.

Reviews.Title: “Pictures are very deceiving compared to the real room, Room itself was not very well taken care of.”
Reviews.Author: kelly4571
Reviews.Content: Pictures are very deceiving compared to the real room, Room itself was not very well taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect before Mt. Sinai surgery”
Reviews.Author: Upstate_NY_people
Reviews.Content: My husband had open heart surgery and we came to the Marmara at the suggestion of the Cardiothoracic Surgery Department at Mt. Sinai. The hotel was clean and quiet, even though we were on the 4th floor and there's ongoing construction on the 2nd Avenue subway. The bed was comfortable, the free Internet (wireless and plugged) was a nice touch, and the bathroom was well appointed. Check the dishwasher for utensils, as the housekeeping staff runs the dishwasher each night with whatever dishes/utensils are used. Takes 20-30 minutes to walk to Mt. Sinai.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Karine_1048
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Marmara Manhattan for four days in September 2010 and we really enjoyed our stay. We rented a one-bedroom apartment and we could not have asked for more size wise. The bedroom was very spacious and so was the living room. I requested a high floor and we were given a room on the 30th floor with an amazing view and huge balcony. We payed $378 per night (plus taxes) and it was money well spent. The level of cleanliness was impeccable. The downsides of our stay was that even though we were on the 30th floor, we could hear construction work on the street throughout the night, hence bring earplugs with you! There is no spa on site and the hotel is a bit out of the city centre, but it is easily accessible by subway which is a 10 minute walk from the hotel. Finally, we experienced both great service and poor service during our stay. One of the evening receptionist was very professional and helpful whereas the rest of the staff was too familiar and not rally professional. But overall, we enjoyed our stay tremendously and we would definetely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Good suite accomodation, decent location”
Reviews.Author: DunstableTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4nights visiting our daughter who hasd been living in Manhattan. One bedroom suite with seperate lounge and kitchen - decent size accommodation , not "luxury" but well appointed clean and quite - 5 minutes walk to the subway pedfrect for a short break

Reviews.Title: “Two for Two!”
Reviews.Author: Wisconsinite007
Reviews.Content: I gave this hotel a great review/recommendation after my August 2009 stay and am even more enthusiastic after another stay their August of 2010. They were running a special rate of $220 per night which was competitive with any of the other top end hotels in the city. But what makes that rate exceptional is you get an unbelievable suite as opposed to the standard hotel room. Our suite was really more like an apartment, with a very spacious bedroom with two huge closets and our own bath. The rest of the suite included a nice, fully equipped kitchen, living room with pull out couch, a separate half bath, and even in-room washer and dryer. The corner suite had a view of the river in one direction and the Empire State Bldng in the other and you can enjoy the view from inside or from your own balcony.
