City noise wasn't noticable because we were pretty high up and on the side of the building away from 2nd Ave. Hotel staff were nice and helpful, the suite was very clean, and the beds were very comfy with great Turkish linens. Location-wise, its an easy taxi ride from LGA, there's a great Italian place across the street and the subway, Central Park, and museums are all within walking distance. Unless they really raised their rates, I wouldn't consider staying any where else.

Reviews.Title: “as if I was staying at a friend's apartment (a nice apartment)”
Reviews.Author: view-with-a-room
Reviews.Content: As if I was staying at a friend's apartment (a nice apartment). The area is residential (for NYC) and a nice contrast to the normal tourist areas. The room was a one bedroom suite and quite large (for NYC). The hotel is an extended stay facility so plan on a trip to the local food store for snacks and drink as none to be found in the hotel. Don't underestimate the value of a nice retreat after the a day in NYC. The Falafel place down the street is great.

Reviews.Title: “apartment living for hotel room rate”
Reviews.Author: jimjade3
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week at the Marmara. It basically is a mid-later twentieth century apartment building converted to hotel. The apartments surprised me. They are attractive, well maintained and very spacious. The full kitchen is large, windowed and well equipped. It's not just a suite, but a well laid out apartment with bath off the hall and not the living room or bed room, so nobody wakes up the other enroute. The service at the front desk is friendly but minimal. One young (looked like) student usually manned the desk and was trying to manage phones, check-in and questions. Don't stay there if you are used to having one of those great concierges staffs, though the desk clerk will do his best to help. There was a friendly security/bellman on duty and visible always. There is a large laundry room and even larger gym in the basement, however the emplyees smoke down there and the air is a little foul. A large grocery is a couple blocks away. The neighborhod is really nice. We had a view of the river. There is 2nd ave subway construction adjacent but much of the work is underground now and the noise didn't bother us. (you might ask for an east oriented room or a high room just in case some above ground work is underway) The area actually seemed less touristy and more residential in feeling than where we usually stay on the west side. The transportation is not as easy as much of the west side, though it sure wasn't bad. The local Lex subway stop is 4 blocks away and here is where you start to notice that all Manhattan is not flat. You have a steep couple of block climb up Carnegie hill to Lexington but a nice coast down when you are coming home. My family will for sure press me to stay at Marmara next trip. They loved it... and it proved a fair cost savings over the my usual west side hotel for much more space. The clientele was international and very nice and friendly - many from Britain and various European countries

Reviews.Title: “spacious apartment with view of Empire State Building”
Reviews.Author: VXM
Reviews.Content: A bunch of 7 girlfriends enjoyed a fun stay at The Marmara. Whilst the location is not in the middle of the best or coolest bars and restaurants - there's plenty of good food locally to be found. The proximity to Museum Mile and Central Park was a real advantage, and being only a five minute walk to the No. 6 subway station, which goes virtually all the way downtown was of great benefit. Staff were friendly and helpful. As with all NY hotels, make sure you ask for full price including tax and if you plan to use the sofa bed, be aware of extra charges. The apartment was enormous in NY terms (and Melbourne terms) and was ideal for a group of friends, with heaps of storage and good bathroom facilities. The views from level 29 were amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable apartment-style hotel within 10 minutes walk of Central Park”
Reviews.Author: ClaraAustralia
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marmara last week and really enjoyed it. Location is a long way north on the Upper East Side, but within easy walking distance to Central Park and the subway line, each 5 - 10 minutes. It is a nice residential area and felt safe to walk around after dark. There's also a good bagel store just down 2nd ave from the Marmara. Staff were both friendly and helpful and the hotel was very clean. We stayed in a studio apartment. The room was very clean and comfortable, with plenty of space. The air-conditioner was very effective and the view was nice. Wireless internet was complimentary and was quick. The Marmara had everything we needed and we would definitely go back. Great value for money given NYC can be fairly pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and clean!”
Reviews.Author: KSMW
Reviews.Content: My husband and our 2 kids (1&2 yr olds) luckily used our credit card reward points to book a 3 night stay and paid for a 2 br upgrade and we are so happy with our pick. The room is spacious and clean and great for traveling with toddlers. The staff is extremely friendly and answered every question professionally. With every good thing there's always a few cons. The rooms are quite a bit outdated and in need of renovation (old old fixtures, door handles are loose and furnishings are different from the pics). The other think to be cautious of is if you're traveling with toddlers, there are alot of electrical wires from the printer and modem that are dangerous. But all in all, were happy with the space. Room to breathe!

Reviews.Title: “What a great apartment”
Reviews.Author: jonsean
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel on the Upper East side with a subway station only a couple of blocks away. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The kitchen was well stocked with the required utensils/plates etc for cooking. We were on an upper floor and had no issue with noise. We would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again. Really enjoyed the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Our family had a great stay in New York's upper east side'e upscale hotel / condo”
Reviews.Author: smsToronto
Reviews.Content: This reasonably priced upscale hotel is great for any traveller. We were there with two young children and the Marmara has a large 1 bedroom condo with a full kitchen, comfortable bed, two big screen tv's and fabulous views of the entire city. The service was always friendly and welcoming. This upper east side location is great since it is near all the museums, Central Park, restaurants and good shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Suites hotel on upper east side”
Reviews.Author: MFR36
Reviews.Content: lovely apt. suites with all brand new fully stocked kitchen (appliances, dishes and pots and pans).Large living room with new large flat screen TV, large bed room with 1 and 1/2 baths. All with a very reasonable price for Manhattan.Loved our stay. Will definately come back and refer it to others. Mort Rubinstein, M.D.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkerfromBeijing
Reviews.Content: I am a native Manhattanite who now lives in China but frequently returns home to visit family and friends. The Marmara is a true "home away from home" for me, and like another recent visitor, I wouldn't stay anyplace else in NYC! The rooms are modern, convenient and spacious, most with gorgeous views of the Manhattan skyline (Empire State Building included) and of the East River, and they are fully equipped with a full-service kitchen that enables one to save on meals if you so choose-- though the neighborhood has many lovely restaurants within walking distance. The staff are always gracious and accommodating, handling all requests with speed and efficiency. They really do make one feel "at home"! They are knowledgeable about New York (though others need this more than me) and help one to access services in the vicinity with ease. The Marmara represents the true style and grace of my hometown and is ideal for families or singles, with lots more space than other hotels like it. It just can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT stay with more room than you will find anywhere else in NYC”
Reviews.Author: CatalinaCanada
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to NYC. We had previously stayed in Jersey City and decided to try to stay in Manhattan if we could find a reasonably priced place. After searching many locations and reading countless reviews, we decided on the Marmara. While a little off the beaten track (upper east side residential area), the Marmara is surrounded by great local places to eat, drink, shop, etc. The nearest subway is four major blocks away and requires a hike up steep East 94th but once there, you are only mins from Central Park, Museum Mile, or a cheap subway ride downtown. There had been comments posted about construction at the base of the hotel so I requested a higher room (we got 19A) which was a very clean and spacious one bedroom suite with living room, kitchen and one bath. It turns out the "construction" is for a new 2nd Ave subway line being built directly in front of the hotel. Early on three weeknights, the hotel was rocked by explosions as crews blasted the new tunnel. Given the general noise of NYC, however, surprisingly this was more of a novel experience than something to complain about BUT...be warned. The room was very clean, the staff was great, every request was met quickly and courteously. My ONLY complaint was that despite getting a discounted rate on the room, the price per night jumped by almost $50 once the additional taxes were added...an additional $250 for 5 nights. While this was displayed on the quote in advance, the budget-minded traveler should consider this a $300/ night hotel. Being three of us (me plus wife and daughter) I had originally been shopping for the most possible space in the low $200/ night range but decided to take a chance on the Marmara based on TripAdvisor reviews. While more than I wanted to spend and EVEN with the explosions, it was great coming back to our room at the Marmara after viewing the many sites of NYC each day. We would definitely return and would highly recommend the Marmara Manhattan if within your budget.

Reviews.Title: “I'll never stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Manas19
Reviews.Content: I'm a frequent visitor to NYC, both for business and cultural tourism, and usually stay in one of a number of mid-priced hotels in midtown. On my most recent, eight-day, visit, I tried the Marmara Manhattan, and I'll never stay anywhere else. Staying at the Marmara is like having your own apartment in an Upper East Side luxury building. The rooms are spacious and tastefully furnished, with a well-equipped kitchenette and great views. The front desk staff couldn't have been more welcoming, and greeted me by name from the first day. The location is excellent, with easy access to the subway and a wide variety of reasonably-priced neighborhood restaurants. What a pleasure to be out of midtown, with its $19-dollar pastrami sandwiches, et. al. Discounts are available for stays longer than an overnight, making the room rate a real bargain (Internet is free). I can't recommend the Marmara highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great”
Reviews.Author: parguy99
Reviews.Content: This is an apartment hotel with full kitchens and was great for traveling with an infant. The carpets were somewhat stained, as was the furniture. The furniture is pretty utilitarian (think IKEA). The location is fine providing you need to be on the upper east side, which we did. It's not a great general location if you are touring New York. The service was very good, however they failed to mention that checkout was at 11:00 and they could have been a bit more pleasant when they called to tell us to get out of our rooms, agreeing to an 11:30 checkout as the absolute latest.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic accommodation - stunning views of Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: DanesOnVacation
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful stay at this hotel. We had a two-bedroom apartment on the 26th floor with absolutely stunning views of Manhattan from all rooms. Our teenage children loved it. We could see the Empire State Building, Central Park and the East River. The apartment was very spacious and equipped with everything we needed, the beds were great and everything was spotlessly clean. The staff were very polite and helpful. There are great supermarkets close by and a cosy restaurant just across the street. In addition, there's just a short walk to the nearest underground station. Next time we come to New York, we'll be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect home away from home”
Reviews.Author: gogirlNewEngland
Reviews.Content: We extended our stay at Marmara within the hour of our arrival because the Marmara is that lovely and ideal for a family visiting NYC. Our "hotel room" was a sprawling, beautiful 1 bedroom apartment with one and a half bath and laundry facilities in the apartment. The apartment was immaculate. The view from every window was stunning and this was the quietest place I have ever stayed in NYC. We ordered out each night and enjoyed fabulous meals delivered to our door. The staff were all very kind and helpful as were residents. Additionally we got great rates for such a wonderful place to stay. We are already planning our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “more relaxed and comfortable stay in the heart of Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: empathyIstanbul
Reviews.Content: It was great stay. Clean & modern decorated room, full kitchen (even fine chinaware)was wonderful. I stayed with my husband, 9 and 19 years children. At the end of the day we supposedly returned our residence. The location is very well. You can easily reach mid/downtown by bus or metro. Employees were very polite. There is no need to search a hotel next time. Here is great one!

Reviews.Title: “Turkish hospitality at its best”
Reviews.Author: KeenYolcu
Reviews.Content: The Marmara Manhattan is a great hotel, especially for extended stays. The suites are simple, clean and comfortable. As far as I know each has a kitchen and separate lounge area. The staff are very welcoming and will do anything to make your stay a pleasant one, exlempifying that famous Turkish hospitality. The Marmara hotel chain is based in Turkey, Istanbul I think. The Marmara hotels in Turkey are well-known and hold a reputation for excellence. The Marmar Manhattan is no exception.

Reviews.Title: “Strongly recommend for any stay -- particularly for Family of Hospital Patients”
Reviews.Author: CTGeorgia
Reviews.Content: I strongly recommend the Marmara Manhattan. My husband was an in-patient at Mt. Sinai Hospital and we did not know the duration of his stay. I am a small town girl and intimidated by staying in New Your City by myself. The Marmara Manhattan became my haven. Nesli (and the others in reservations) are wonderful. They understand that surgical and medical stays are unpredictable in duration and very stressful. They provided us a great rate because my husband was in-patient at Mt. Sinai and were very flexible in scheduling. The hotel is very attractive, clean, roomy, and well maintained. It is unique, not your standard cookie cutter rooms. It is about a 20 minute walk to Mt. Sinai which I enjoyed taking. The suites are really attractive and even my teenage daughters were saying what I good job I had done finding it! In addition to the great rate, it has a full kitchen and a grocery around the corner. I cooked most meals there and was able to keep down the cost of my stay. What particularly struck me about the Marmara Manhattan is that everyone from reservations, to the front desk, to the doorman and bellhop, were friendly and helpful. This place understands customer service. Unfortunately we will not be coming back to the Marmara because my husband has chosen to change hospitals to Cleveland Clinic. When he is all fixed up and healthy again, my goal is to return to the Marmara for a few days with my family and relax and spend some time with them in the city. If you need to find a place while a family member is in one of the nearby hospitals, choose the Marmara Manhattan. I talked to other families who had chosen the Wales and the Marriot. They were not nearly as happy with their choices as I was with mine.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel with great customer service”
Reviews.Author: Stephen83
Reviews.Content: We travelled to New York with our 8 month old son and felt when we booked we would need cooking amenities and this hotel provided all we would need and more. They were extremely helpful from the moment of arrival to the moment of departure, including directing us to a great diner nearby and changing the crib they provided for a smaller size (american cribs are very large) they gave us a bassinette which is a travel cot! The front of house staff were always very friendly, no matter what time of day or night and the maid service were superb and catered for our family's needs very well. Although there is work on a new subway branch going on nearby I would certainly not let this put you off staying here as it did not bother us at all as and we were on the side of the work and on a lower floor. Although it is located a little further out than a central location like Times Square, the nearby subway meant that nowhere was further away than 20 minutes at the most.

Reviews.Title: “Stay where people live in New York City!”
Reviews.Author: McBayles
Reviews.Content: We stayed while in New York as tourists for 3 nights. There were 6 of us and had a 3 bedroom, 3 bath unit. It was spacious and very comfortable. We had a small kitchen with everything we needed. It had a balcony and lots of windows to see all sides of New York. We could see the Empire State Building in the distance from our bedroom. The staff was very helpful, assisted us with getting downtown and getting a car service back to the airport. The building that is used for residential and rental so very quiet. It is on the Upper East Side, where the people live. Bagel Shop, restaurants, grocery store, ice cream, drug stores, you name it and it was close by. We took the Subway downtown and it was very easy, convenient and interesting. If you want to be out late in the hustle and bustle of downtown this is NOT where you want to stay. We wanted to be able to have a large comfortable room, go out all day and come back in the evenings and relax. It was perfect for that.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury way up on the Upper East side!”
Reviews.Author: MLBguy
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at one of the chain's Istanbul properties, I was happy to get a good deal on this upscale hotel. The professional staff and spotless room made for a great mid-week stay. Even on the 8th floor, I had a neat city view. I prefer neighborhoods like this one although it is not in convenient walking distance to much of interest. Cabs can be expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: travelmoreLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in September. We used it as a base for exploring New York. The best facility this hotel offers is the Kitchenette, which means you can relax without the need to constantly eat in restaurants or diners. The room was clean and very spacious. The area was slightly run down, and we noticed some unsavoury looking characters around the first night but not really a problem. Main drawback was that there was a lot of noise from the street.

Reviews.Title: “So much room”
Reviews.Author: netsky64
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the size of this place. It was our first place in New York City after a long haul from Australia. We got a great deal on Wotif.com (for NYC) and this was a one bedroom apartment with everything supplied. The bed was particularly comfortable and the staff friendly. It was clean with a full kitchen if you like to cook. I highly recommend this hotel in the upper East side. Its a kind of residential area which is nice. Superb vegetarian restaurant - Candle Cafe - close by. Stay here if you can its so much better and three times the size of anything else in NYC! Only shame was the construction of a subway station outside the hotel! But still worth it.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: stutravel
Reviews.Content: We had a one bedroom arpartment at the Marmara. It was a very nice place to stay. We were very happy with the Marmara because we got great value for money having paid about US$234 a night for three nights. For this we got a large one bedroom apartment which included a good sized loungeroom, and kitchen. It was clean and in a quite location on th Upper East Side. It was the best of the four places we stayed in over a couple of weeks in NYC by far but I think that's because of the price. If we had to pay another $100 a night for it I think our view would be different. The staff were all exceptionally friendly and charming and helpful, the best we encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like I was a native New Yorker!”
Reviews.Author: GráinneM
Reviews.Content: I don't need a 6 star hotel to be happy, but I am picky. I loved staying in the Marmara! One of the things that I look for is good communication before I stay in a hotel. To say the Marmara doesn't disappoint is an understatement! I had looked at the rates on the site and was pleased to see that I could get a studio suite for less than a single bedroom with shared bathroom midtown. I don't know New York well though and wanted to know how easy it would be to get to Columbia-Presbyterian (W 168th St) and NYU Medical Center (E 33rd Street). I emailed and got a response the same day from the wonderful Neslihan. She gave me a full rundown of transport options. She then offered a free upgrade to a one bed suite if I wanted to book. I did! A while later I emailed to ask if I could have some online shopping delivered. No problem. If it arrived before I did they would hold it. So: Location: Some people wouldn't like being well up the Upper East Side (technically Yorkville really) but I was glad I was there. The hotel is on 94th Street and 2nd Avenue and easily accessible by subway-stop is on 96th street. Every time I strolled around 34th street I was glad I was living away from the crazy throngs of tourists. The area around the Marmara is far more residential and you kind of get to feel like you're living in New York. There are plenty of grocery and drugstores nearby, ranging from expensive ones like Dean and Deluca to the cheap and cheerful Pioneer/C-Town and midrange Gristedes and D'Agostinos. I made many trips to Crumbs, Glasers and Two Little Red Hens bakeries also. Very close to Guggenheim, Whitney and Met. It's a few blocks east to Central Park where you can go for lovely runs around the reservoir.... I'm missing it already! Check-in: I arrived early but they managed to find me a room straight away. They had kept a package for me...and knew before I asked. It was swift and the guy on the desk was really friendly. Room: Well, it was an apartment really! I was on the 18th floor. Large bedroom with TV and loads of storage. Bed was quite hard but I got used to it. Couldn't sleep with street noise first night but managed every other night so it may have been due to being over-tired at the start. There was a full kitchen with a massive fridge, and everything you could need-utensils, plates, cups, plates, saucepans etc. Even sealable Pyrex bowls. I particularly liked it that there was a dishwasher...and they provided detergent, washing-up liquid and rubber gloves. Nice touch! There was a little pack with 2 bottles of water, coffee, tea, creamer and sweeteners also. Living room comfy with TV, DVD player and fax machine/copier. Everything spotless Amenities: Small fitness room with some weights, elliptical, treadmill, bikes, rower and TV. More than adequate and never full. There's also a laundry room with a few washers and dryers. Didn't have to wait for a machine. Cute little gallery in lobby which was lovely to see when you arrive in the door. There's also a laptop set up there with internet access, as well as free WiFi in the rooms. No restaurant but loads outside and they deliver. Staff: Wonderful. I was greeted with a hello and a smile every single time I entered or left. Both the doormen and the front desk staff were charming and exceedingly helpful. Heard them giving extensive area advice to guests and they accepted all my deliveries and made sure I got them. A car was organised to bring me to the airport and they also printed out my boarding pass for me! Downsides: Slow elevators. Bit noisy... These would in no way prevent me from staying here again! So so happy with my decision.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for NYC accomodation”
Reviews.Author: MarnieinAustralia
Reviews.Content: First trip to NYC and stayed in hotel in Tribeca first then at Marmara - the latter was much better, and much better value at the same price. You can go cheaper if willing to share a bathroom, but I was so not going there! Huge suite (larger than my apartment in Sydney), full kitchen, aircon, nice and quiet, all amenities (two full bathrooms!) and balcony at Marmara vs small room with no frig in Tribeca for the same $$$. Actually did happy dance in foyer once the bellman left after bringing me up to the room. Friends warned me the Upper East Side was a bit far from 'the action', but is two blocks from subway and NYC public transport is so good you can get anywhere quickly with a Metrocard. There are also plenty of restaurants/cafes/etc close by and a short walk to Central Park, Met, shopping on 5th Ave, etc. Am used to staying at Westin/Hyatt for work so have high standards. Worst things that happened were towel rail fell off (easily fixed) and needed new wine opener (quickly supplied) - great welcome to NYC. There is road works happening outside on 2nd Ave - common in NYC - but no noise during night.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: AlbertaTraveller8
Reviews.Content: We had a good sized one-bedroom suite, nicely decorated in modern style. Fully equipped kitchen with dishwasher, fridge, etc. TV in both sitting room and bedroom. Huge closet with shelves in bedroom. Very clean. No complaints whatsoever about the hotel. We weren't as pleased with the location--the hotel was surrounded by construction (subway?). It was several blocks to the nearest subway, and a taxi trip to downtown cost $20. There were some good nearby restaurants--we liked Nick's Restaurant ( across the street because of the construction) which serves very generous proportions of Italian food --an excellent choice for families. We enjoyed breakfast at the Barking Dog restaurant, a couple of blocks up the street, which is also good for lunch.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: drake433
Reviews.Content: We had the great luck to book a two-night stay at the Marmara Manhattan after our search for accomodations at the more "traditional" hotels didn't bear fruit. For $225.00 a night, we had a one bedroom, two bath suite on the 28th floor with great city views. The suite had a living room, dining area and full kitchen, entry hall, two full baths and a large bedroom with a king-size bed. There were two televisions and windows surrounded all of the exterior walls. There was also a printer/copier/fax in the room for our use. The staff, including the doorman and the front desk people were very courteous and welcoming. This hotel was truly a find if you have a reason to stay in this upper east-side neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: HeatherMarie09
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NY! It was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value at the Marmara Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Wisconsinite007
Reviews.Content: My wife, 4.5 yr old daughter and I stayed for 3 nights in a 14th floor, 1 BR standard suite @ $167 per night including taxes and fees. Pluses were the full sized kitchen, very roomy BR, nice bedding, pull-out couch, a good sized bath, free Wi-Fi, and overall cleanliness. Tons of storage space and the corner suite provided amazing views of the East River and NYC. The location was within pretty easy walking distance to museums, Central Park and subway stations. The furniture, including TV weren’t new but they were very serviceable. On the down side, with all the windows and subway construction below, it was a bit noisy but you’re in NYC after all. Also, the front desk wanted to charge us $35 per night to make up the sleeper couch but we pointed out that the reservation was clearly for 3 people and that there was no mention of the extra bedding charge when the reservation was made. They agreed to waive the charge without too much squabbling. We’ve stayed at other all-suite hotels in Manhattan and this was by far the best value of the bunch. Would highly recommend it and definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “!”
Reviews.Author: MaxPepsi
Reviews.Content: Firstly Thankyou to Nestleh and the other staff for making our stay so welcoming. We came over to New York from the UK for a 5 night break and we loved the Marmara. We found all staff were very accomodating indeed. We made a request in advance for a certain room spec and Nestleh was able to deliver exactly what we asked - How could we ask for more than that! so thankyou Nestleh! - therefore making our stay very positive from the start. New Yorkers to our surprise were very polite! - shocking I know, but we found the New Yorkers in town much more friendly than most Brits in London etc!. They are very friendly indeed - like to talk in lifts etc rather than us Brits who hold back from talking! Rather than brash, we found the New Yorkers we met talked very straight and to the point! there was no beating around the bush and we liked that! It isn't really a hotel in the traditional sense, ie there is no bar for example. but it is a 32+ storey complex with a chandelier in the lift! We had a gorgeous high suite room complete with dishwasher cooker fridge- massive bed too - about 7ft wide! 2 tvs, it was more of an apartment than a room (about 500 sq ft.!) ..and gave us a good idea of the lifestyle that condo living may entail in NY. The area is safe and full of New york Charm with restaurants and Delis. Out Taxi driver on the way back drove like a maniac but thats another story....We were a little concerned when he took us on a shortcut through a real rough part of Harlem...with cars on bricks and gangs on corners - but he got us to JFK in the end...... If you see a guy in Times square asking you to come to stand up NY club on 78 and broadway- he sells the tickets but doesnt mention you have to buy 2 full price drinks in the club which the cheapest are around 10 dollars each! Have a good time - and enjoy the Marmara!!!!! remember to tip the staff they will appreciate it and reward you with excellent service!! You might want to try citysights (blue tour buses) rather than the red bus guys as they were far cheaper over 5 days.....try to get a discount too! we did! its a good way to get around. taci to time square area will cost about 12 dollars with tip ENJOY, but have your wits about you in town too!

Reviews.Title: “Upper East Side comfort”
Reviews.Author: GaPeach56
Reviews.Content: This is my absolute favorite place to stay in NYC. I prefer the neighborhood feel of staying on the Upper East Side. There are wonderful little speciality grocery stores and deli's with in a short distance from the Marmara. There are also several very good restaurants within walking distance. I drove in to help a family member move and there were two enclosed garages within a block of the hotel. We were on the 15th floor with a beautiful view of the Hudson. This unit was a full apartment with 1 and 1/2 baths. It suited our needs perfectly. The staff is friendly and always available to help with any request. There is subway construction going on at the 2nd Ave. side but, we only heard construction noise later in the day. It was not a problem at night or early morning. The spaciousness of the units make this the perfect place to stay with extended family.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: ellencCaymanIslands
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Marmara for 2 nights and it were 2 noisy sleepless nights. The room was OK although we made the reservation telling them we needed the sofabed. We arrived at midnight with two children who were very tired and the bed wasn't made. There we're works in progress in the street below and the glass of the room was very thin, so it was like sleeping on the pavement. We asked for another room, but they told us we just had bad luck. So: never again. This year I'm gonna try the Avalon Vincci.

Reviews.Title: “Not happy here”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkStateHilda
Reviews.Content: I will not come back to the Marmara. I couldn't get a reservation for a room for my whole stay so had to check out and check back into another room. I was expecting this but I wasn't expecting to have to wait in the lobby for 4 hours before I was allowed to check back in. I was told I had to be checked out at 11 am - no exceptions and was not allowed to check back in until official check in of 3 p.m. I even had a cat with me and medication that needed to stay refrigerated and they still wouldn't let me in my room. When I checked out I was overcharged and told that their online reservation system didn't calculated the tax correctly and there was nothing they could do about it. The WIFI internet access barely worked. The connection would only work for a few minutes before the connection was lost. The bed was as hard as a rock and when I asked for a room with a better bed I was told there was nothing available. I would mention good points but I can't think of any.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Ivy1954
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 4 nights - good location for attending conference at Mt. Sinai Hospital. Very spacious, big closets, very clean except for the outside windows - must have been years since they were washed. Entire hotel seems quite dated. We did not have any special requests of the staff, but they were all very friendly. Many good restaurants in area, every block has several. Easy walk to Central Park, museums. Internet available in lobby, but painfully slow connection.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this place!”
Reviews.Author: travelingphotogPa
Reviews.Content: Everything about this property is perfect. easy to get to, wonderful, friendly and helpful staff, amazing location, views best in the city, 32nd floor penthouse was the most luxurious room I have stayed in for many years. I could not say enough about my one day stay, except that it was way too short!

Reviews.Title: “felt like home!”
Reviews.Author: orangeblossomm
Reviews.Content: Last summer we decided to renew our apartment and we stayed at the Marmara for 2 months while our house was getting redecorated. Our stay was one of the best hotel-experiences in my life. The rooms were spacious, very clean and new. the staff was one of the kindest in new york. I not only caught up with my normal life while I was away from my on house, but I also enjoyed my stay a lot

Reviews.Title: “I look forward to my stay at the Marmara!!”
Reviews.Author: turksgirl24
Reviews.Content: I travel weekly from Indiana and stay at the Marmara! It is truly a home away from home! The staff is incredibel especially Elif Akinci who continues to go out of her way to accommadate my requests! I will continue to stay here for my travel needs! Sandi

Reviews.Title: “the staff was extremely helpful and accomodating”
Reviews.Author: teacher5NewYork
Reviews.Content: These apartments are a wonderful choice for those who need more than just a typical hotel room in NYC. They are clean, spacious and have all amenities you would need. The staff was extremely helpful and worked with us to select the right accommodations and make our stay run smoothly.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding East side hotel”
Reviews.Author: LAB767
Reviews.Content: The Marmara is an imposing upper East side hotel and an extended stay facility, with a museum quality lobby. The staff was courteous, personable and professional. But, by far, it was the suite itself that stole the show. Clean, new, and contemporary, with thoughtful amenities. If you ever want to want to know the feeling of what it's like to live in NYC, check this hotel out. On the 16th floor, and with four suites to a floor, we were surrounded by other skyscrapers, had a terrace, and had an obstructed view of the East River. A total cosmopolitan experience. Only cons - construction abounds, there's a lot of NYC street noise and no parking. Again, welcome to NYC, but in a genuine, upscale way. Treat yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Too Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1234577
Reviews.Content: Room is very good; a bedroom and living room together, very spacy. However, there is a very big road construction just in front of the hotel. Almost 24 hours noise, especially from 6am onwards.... Unhelpful, unflexible front desk! We have asked for a few hours late check out to shop in the morning and to leave hotel at 3 pm. Although the hotel was almost empty, it is not allowed. Because of this at the last day of our holiday in NY we had very bad last day experience.

Reviews.Title: “Just like being at home!”
Reviews.Author: Karend68
Reviews.Content: It was my first time at the Marmara Hotel. It was great like having an apartment in the city! Service was impeccable, rooms where clean and modern! Great place...

Reviews.Title: “The Best Value On An Apartment-Style Hotel Room!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingGal62
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a week at The Marmara Manhattan while staying in NYC on business. It was like having my own apartment in the city as I had a studio with its own kitchen and plenty of space to spread out and work. It was very affordable, incredibly comfortable, and I brought my dog with me as they accept pets!

Reviews.Title: “Best Luxury Apartment in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Istanbulchi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in MANY luxury apartment s all over the world from Hong Kong, Europe, and the USA, but the Marmara Manhattan was the best in terms on comfort, cleanliness, and service. I also like the "quietness" of being in the Upper East Side after a long day of shopping and sightseeing. I am definitely staying here again when I am in town. Chi

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great rooms, a wonderful respite after a busy Manhattan day!”
Reviews.Author: On_The_Go082
Reviews.Content: My second stay at The Marmara, plan on making this gem my NY home away from home! For one night or many this is a wonderful spot. The accommodations are outstanding, and the rates are more than fair. The staff is friendly and helpful, the rooms are clean bright and welcoming after a busy Manhattan day. Nicely located - near public transportation, walking distance to great shopping, museums, and wonderful neighborhood eateries! I can't imagine ever being confined to a small hotel room again. I will be back ! Savannah Ga.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: writerNyc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marmara and was absolutely thrilled with the service and the suite. We stayed in the Penthouse after a performance of my play. It was extraordinary. The guests I invited were very very impressed. I don't think I have recieved so many e-mail thanking me for such a wonderful time in an incredible space. The view is breathtaking. I will stay there again in a New York Minute. Thank you everyone at the Hotel. Adrienne Foran I would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Room for the Money.”
Reviews.Author: alaskansurfer
Reviews.Content: I had a very nice stay here. The room was Great! One bedroom suite with full kitchen. Everything a person could need is nearby. Only three blocks from subway. I highly recommend Nick's across the street for a nice meal or pizza. Korean laundry was good and cheap. Only down side is there is major subway construction work going on on 2nd in front of hotel. Did not bother me or keep me awake.

Reviews.Title: “Loving the Marmara!!”
Reviews.Author: JayBucks
Reviews.Content: Well what can I say? I have been too Manhattan three times and I can safely say this is the best accommodation I have stayed in. The apartment we had was fantastic. No central park view but hey, how long do you spend in your apartment?! A couple of blocks from the Maramra is a little restaurant and bar called the Barking Dog. Food is fantastic and so is the price. Great service apart from one time. You will find it at, 150 E 34th St. Try it out. You are about 6 blocks away from Central Park and 5th Avenue. Not far from the museums. There is a store across the road from the Marmara that sells all the essentials you need. A fantastic stay. Will stay again here next time!!!!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: Vick911
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful hotel in a beautiful area. Subway is walking distance, everybody was friendly! The room was so clean, and had everything we needed. Thanks Maramara, I would recommend you to everyone!

HotelInfo.Name: Marmara Manhattan Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 301 East 94th Street, New York City, NY 10128
